crew.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: all the people who work on a ship or plane
crew.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The plane crashed, killing two of the crew and four passengers.
He joined the crew of a large fishing boat.
crew.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a group of people working together with special skills
crew.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a team of people who compete in rowing races
crew.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Who will be on the college crew?
crew.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a group of people or friends – often used to show disapproval
crew.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The volunteers were a motley crew (=very mixed group of people).
Do you still hang out with the same crew?
crew.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a group of musicians, especially ones playing hip hop, rap, or garage music
crew.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a group of hip hop dancers
crew.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a group of young people who spend time together, often one that is involved in crime, drugs, or violence
crew.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: a group of people working together with special skills
crew.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: The film crew were making a political documentary.
Journalists and TV crews were waiting outside their house.
There is a cast of 100 and a stage crew of twenty.
She’s a member of the production crew for a new television series.
Fire crews took more than three hours to bring the blaze under control.
The woman had to be rescued from her car by an ambulance crew.
The ground crew were refueling the plane.
I was impressed by the polite and efficient cabin crew.
crew.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to be part of the crew on a boat
crew.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The boat is crewed by ten men.
crew.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: all the people working on a ship or plane
crew.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: These planes carry over 300 passengers and crew.
crew.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: all the people working on a ship or plane except the most important officers
crew.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: The captain instructed the cabin crew to prepare for take-off.
